intro: Hedyosmum hirsutum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or hirsute hedyosmum, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Hedyosmum hirsutum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
